page.title: 04LANDSCAPE/OVERTON/THE VIEW
page.content:
A VIEW FROM THE HALL GREAVES
Hall Greave is very silent, Only the river Lune is violent, The marsh spreads out where a road winds through, Its hazy,but the sky is blue. We look down on the gullies, Near Sunderland Point: I can see several farms, With quite a few barns, As I admire the expanse of marsh. The shelducks with their children, On the river,a few boats, And some buoys,like floats, I can see tops of trees, And feel a gentle breeze. There's a pond And I'm fond Of the violent river Lune. Over there I see a pair Of white sea-gulls.
